Class Server.ClientConnection

  • Enclosing class:

    public static class Server.ClientConnection
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that wraps a socket ands its IO

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private void connectionThread()
      Parse the incoming transmission using Message.parseMessage(Socket, DataInputStream) Updates the timestamp of ourselves to send most recent update to the sender Send back a response to the incoming request using sendResponse() If the incoming message is an HTTP request for the web page we call sendHtml(String) with Message.buildHtml()
      static void dos(Node node) 
      void readRunInThread()
      Implementing the reading of incoming communication in a new thread
      protected void sendBin(byte[] data)
      Sending raw binary data
      protected void sendHtml(java.lang.String body)
      handle the wrapping of an HTML massage
      private void sendMessage(int cmd)
      Incrementally sends the message according to the specified binary format
      private void sendRequest()
      Wraps sendMessage(int) and sends with the cmd = 1 (request)
      private void sendResponse()
      Wraps sendMessage(int) and sends with the cmd = 0 (response)
      private static java.net.Socket setUpSocket(java.lang.String host, char port) 
      void startConnection(Node node)
      Implementing the outgoing communication using sendRequest() if the returned message has new information we will update 3 random nodes from our LocalNodeList.localList using ServerActive.chooseAndSend() if the node is new and we didn't manage to get a response we are incrementing the tries counter

      • dos

        public static void dos(Node node)

      • readRunInThread

        public void readRunInThread()
        Implementing the reading of incoming communication in a new thread

      • connectionThread

        private void connectionThread()
        Parse the incoming transmission using Message.parseMessage(Socket, DataInputStream) Updates the timestamp of ourselves to send most recent update to the sender Send back a response to the incoming request using sendResponse()

        If the incoming message is an HTTP request for the web page we call sendHtml(String) with Message.buildHtml()

      • sendBin

        protected void sendBin(byte[] data)
                throws java.io.IOException
        Sending raw binary data
        Parameters:
        data - the binary data to send as a byte array
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the sending have a problem

      • sendRequest

        private void sendRequest()
        Wraps sendMessage(int) and sends with the cmd = 1 (request)

      • startConnection

        public void startConnection(Node node)
                     throws Server.UnInitializedSocket
        Implementing the outgoing communication using sendRequest()

        if the returned message has new information we will update 3 random nodes from our LocalNodeList.localList using ServerActive.chooseAndSend()

        if the node is new and we didn't manage to get a response we are incrementing the tries counter

        Throws:
        Server.UnInitializedSocket

      • sendResponse

        private void sendResponse()
        Wraps sendMessage(int) and sends with the cmd = 0 (response)

      • sendMessage

        private void sendMessage(int cmd)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Incrementally sends the message according to the specified binary format
        Parameters:
        cmd - indicates if the message is a response or a request
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if something went wrong

      • sendHtml

        protected void sendHtml(java.lang.String body)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        handle the wrapping of an HTML massage
        Parameters:
        body - The content - actual html page
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if something in the sending fails
